comment: 3400 is a difficult course, so even though attendance isn't mandatory, you better show up and listen if you want to have a chance to understand it.  Dr. Li is a caring professor who will explain whatever you need her to, and she's available outside class if needed.  Also, 25% of your grade is group projects, so find a good group to work with.

Professor Li is one of the sweetest professors at KSU!  The class was kind of boring, but if you didn't understand she was glad to help. She was very flexible with assignments and cares a lot about her student.

Dr. Li is an amazing professor who teaches good lectures. All her classes typically have weekly/monthly quizzes, two exams, and an optional final exam which cannot hurt you. This is the first semester she taught ISYE 3350, and she taught it well. No matter what class she teaches, she has a consistent format and teaching style.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Li is an amazing professor. She always came to class with a positive attitude and taught the lecture material perfectly. ISYE 3400 is a tough class, but she taught the material in a way that made the difficult material easier to learn. To expect: Two tests, homework every week (quizzes), an optional final, and a group project.

She explains the content very clearly. Attendance is not required, but if you don't attend I don't think you will do good. There is many examples in class that helped me understand things well. Study the quizzes for the test and you will do good.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Li is so nice. Her lectures were just powerpoints that you could go through at home, but it makes more sense if you attend class. Her tests were tough, but she is a fair grader if you just put effort into your answer. She gave a couple of easy quizzes that you could work on with classmates. Overall great teacher.

Dr. Li is the best. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed, and will do everything in her power to make sure you do well in her class. Attendance is not mandatory but it will be hard to pass her class if you do not attend. The material and her exams can be tough but she is generous with partial credit and is a fair grader.

I took Operations Research with Professor Li. If you do not watch lectures you will not pass! Make sure you follow all instructions to a T or you will get a lower grade even if you have the right answer in the wrong format. I wouldn't take her again, there was a language barrier, but overall she did exactly what she claimed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The subject material, linear programming, is difficult by nature, however she gives awesome lectures and supplementary material. If you make use of it and put in the effort, you will not have a problem. I hear many complaints on this class, and when queried, they admit they never bothered to watch or attend even one lecture. You won't do well.
